block.p: Anne Hsiu-Chi Perng, a daughter of Mei-Jen and Dr. Wuu-Jau Perng of Medina, Ohio, was married yesterday in London to Alun Pichaya Branigan, the son of Nong Branigan and Dr. Keith Branigan of Sheffield, England. Richard Beacham, a superintendent registrar of the Westminster Register Office, officiated at the National Liberal Club in London.

The couple work in Bangkok. The bride is an assistant vice president of the Adkinson Securities Public Company, a securities brokerage company, and the bridegroom is the director of corporate finance in Thailand for Dresdner Kleinwort Benson, the London investment bank.

Anne Hsiu-Chi Perng, a daughter of Mei-Jen and Dr. Wuu-Jau Perng of Medina, Ohio, was married yesterday in London to Alun Pichaya Branigan, the son of Nong Branigan and Dr. Keith Branigan of Sheffield, England. Richard Beacham, a superintendent registrar of the Westminster Register Office, officiated at the National Liberal Club in London.

The couple work in Bangkok. The bride is an assistant vice president of the Adkinson Securities Public Company, a securities brokerage company, and the bridegroom is the director of corporate finance in Thailand for Dresdner Kleinwort Benson, the London investment bank.

Mrs. Branigan, 31, graduated cum laude from the School of Foreign Service at Georgetown University, with bachelor's and master's degrees in international politics. Her father is a family practice physician in Hinckley, Ohio. Her mother, who is retired, was an owner of the Dragon Gourmet, a restaurant in North Olmstead, Ohio.
Mr. Branigan, 34, graduated from Lancaster University in England. His father is a professor of archaeology at Sheffield University, where the bridegroom's mother is a counselor to Thai students.
